alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clarendon; Orangeburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 05 at 6:58PM EDT until April 05 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Southeastern Calhoun County in central South Carolina... Southwestern Clarendon County in central South Carolina... East central Orangeburg County in central South Carolina... * Until 745 PM EDT. * At 657 PM EDT, a confirmed large and extremely dangerous tornado was located near Bowman, or 12 miles southeast of Brookdale, moving northeast at 45 mph. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. TAKE COVER NOW! HAZARD...Damaging tornado. SOURCE...Orangeburg County Emergency management confirmed a tornado southeast of Rowesville at 647 PM. This tornado is over I-26 moving towards I-95! IMPACT...You are in a life-threatening situation. Flying debris may be deadly to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be destroyed. Considerable damage to homes, businesses, and vehicles is likely and complete destruction is possible. * The tornado will be near... Elloree around 710 PM EDT. Santee State Park around 715 PM EDT. Summerton around 725 PM EDT. Santee Cooper Regional Airport around 735 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Indian Bluff Recreation Park, Poplar Creek Landing, St. Paul, Santee, Davis Station, Stumphole Landing, Yonder Field, Mill Creek Marina and Campground, Vance and Paxville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 26 between mile markers 156 and 165. Interstate 95 between mile markers 90 and 118. TORNADO...OBSERVED TORNADO DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a large, extremely dangerous and potentially deadly tornado is on the ground. To protect your life, TAKE COVER NOW! If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor of a sturdy building immediately. Being in a vehicle during a tornado is not safe. Drive to the closest sturdy building and move to an interior room or closet on the lowest floor. As a last resort, abandon your car and seek shelter in a ditch or low lying area away from trees. Do not seek shelter under highway overpasses.
